idea: Get your fortune told - Go to a fortune teller and have your tarot cards read. Whether or not your fortune actually comes true, it's a fun way to think about your future together.
Use a coloring book - Coloring isn't just for kids! Put on some relaxing music and split a box of crayons, markers, or pencils to go to town.
Scrapbook - Move your favorite photos off your phone and into your hands. You can save ticket stubs and love notes alongside pictures of your favorite times together.
Make cocktails at home - Pick a few cocktail recipes and practice mixing drinks together. It's fun, creative, and you get to enjoy the results.
Build a pillow fort - Grab your coziest blankets and pillows and fill your fort with twinkle lights, snacks, and a romantic playlist to have your own secret place to snuggle.
Play a video game - Download something slow and low stakes like Animal Crossing or The Sims to play collaboratively, or competitive games like Mario Kart to battle it out.
Play with clay - Embrace nostalgia and buy some colorful clay. It's a hands-on way to embrace your creativity, with lots of potential to get silly.
Build a craft kit - You can try Lego, model replicas, or any other kind of kit that includes all the materials and instructions. It's great practice for that Ikea furniture.
Practice a language together - Pick a language you both want to learn and spend the evening practicing basic phrases and having conversations.
Redecorate - Do you have new artwork to hang on the wall or a beautiful vintage rug you scored at the flea market? Put on some upbeat tunes and redecorate together.
Restaurant hop - If you've got your favorite spot's menu just about memorized, check out a few new places instead. Visit a food hall or head to an area with different restaurants.
Visit a local art exhibit - Check out a temporary art exhibit or gallery opening for a cultural evening together.
Watch a local theater production - Find a community theater or small production for an intimate cultural experience.
Try an escape room - Put your logic to the test and try to solve the puzzle before time runs out.
Make a fun new recipe - Even if you're not much of a cook, trying out a new dish can result in lots of laughs. And when you're done, you get to eat the results.
Play a board game - Drag out the classics or try a brand new one for a healthy dose of competition. Toss in a friendly wager to spice things up a little.
Throw a casino night - If they call you Lady Luck, see if your partner can roll snake eyes and win your heart. That, or play cards with that week's chore list on the line.
Play hide 'n seek - It's not just for kids anymore.
Look through old photos - Pull out the albums and get ready for an awwww-fest. Share stories of your childhoods and your awkward teen years.
Visit an antique store - Browse a local antique store and look for interesting items.
Make a craft together - Creativity feels even more satisfying when you do a project with your sweetheart. Don't worry if you're not a pro artist; there's beauty in imperfection.
See a comedy show - Laughing gets endorphins flowing, and comedy often comes cheaper than other forms of live entertainment. Even really bad standup can be fun, in its own way.
Visit an open house - Check out a local open house or estate sale.

Tackle a home improvement project - If you've been meaning to hang some shelves or finally cleaning out your closet, enlist the help of your main squeeze. Doing it together will make the task go by faster.
Do karaoke - Everyone's a star at karaoke, especially if you can find the kind with private rooms. The sappier ballads you belt out, the better.
Go ax-throwing - As soon as you let the first one fly, you'll understand why ax-throwing is so popular. It's also a great way to unload some stress.
Put together a puzzle - There's something so satisfying about finally clicking that last piece into place, plus it's good for the ol' noodle.
Go bowling - This is one instance in which you actually want to strike out.
Have a romantic dinner at home - Cook a special meal and set up a romantic atmosphere.
Challenge them at an arcade - Go a few rounds at Ms. Pacman and Big Deer Hunter for a unique night out that will bring out your competitive side.
Try a new fancy coffee or tea - If you usually take it black or with just sugar or cream, branch out! Hit up a local coffee shop and try the most offbeat offering they've got.
Visit a museum exhibit - Pick a specific exhibit or section to explore together rather than the entire museum.
Go out for dessert - I don't know about you, but I'm always too full to get dessert after a nice dinner. Make dessert the main event instead.
Cook a new recipe together - Pick a challenging recipe you've never tried and cook it together.
Visit a local market - Browse a farmers market and pick up fresh ingredients for a meal.
Try a new restaurant - Whether it's a cuisine you've never tried or a place that just opened, trying something new together is always an adventure.
Have a picnic - Pack a basket with your favorite foods, grab a blanket, and head to a park or beach. Bonus points if you bring a bottle of wine.
Have a wine tasting at home - Buy a few different wines and taste them together.
Dance together at home - Put on some music and practice dancing together in your living room.
Take a short nature walk - Find a local park or trail for a leisurely walk together.
Rent paddleboards for an hour - Many lakes offer hourly paddleboard rentals.
Try indoor rock climbing - Many gyms offer day passes for indoor climbing.
Do yoga together at home - Follow a yoga video or app together.
Go for a swim - Visit a local pool or beach for a refreshing swim.
Play mini golf - It's fun, competitive, and usually pretty affordable. Plus, you get to be outside.
Have a movie night at home - Set up a cozy movie viewing area with blankets and snacks.
Stargaze together - There's just something inherently romantic about staring up at the night sky. Bring a blanket to the backyard or a local park.
Watch the sunset - There's a reason so many romantic movies end this way.
Order each other's meal - See how well you know your loved one's tastes by ordering for the other at dinner. No swapping back when the food arrives!
Make your own pizza - Yes, including the dough. Top it with all of the classics, or go with personal pies and challenge each other to come up with the tastiest new combo.
Read a book together - Pick a book and take turns reading chapters aloud to each other.
Have a backyard campout - Set up a tent in your backyard and spend the evening outside.
Cook a fancy dinner for two - Plan and cook a multi-course meal together.
Have a themed movie night - But make it a theme. Choose a flick and add snacks to match. Think The Godfather and cannoli or Ratatouille and, well, you know.

Make a romantic playlist - Remember when you used to exchange mix tapes with your crush back in the day? Thanks to streaming services, it's easier than ever to create a musical journey through your relationship.
Paint and sip - If you've got a paint nite program nearby, it's a fun and easy date. If not, get some canvasses, pour some bevies, and throw your own.
Try tie-dye - You may have noticed that all kinds of things are tie-dyed lately. Get in on the trend by making your own. Even if it doesn't come out perfectly, you'll have a fun memory.
Watch a sports game - Even high school sports can get your adrenaline going if you get really, really into it. And, in most cases, you can watch from your couch.
Have a breakfast date - Turn date night on its head and start your day with some couple time. Mimosas highly encouraged, if you partake.
Have a staycation at home - Transform your home into a vacation destination for the evening.
Build a snowman (or a sand sculpture) - Make the most of the weather by creating a new friend.
Shop for charity - Food pantries, homeless shelters and community organizations need supplies all year round. Spread the love while spending quality time with your partner.
Listen to podcasts - For a twist on the usual movie night, cuddle up and turn on a podcast instead.
Do couples' yoga - Getting bendy together can really heat things up, plus you're doing something good for your body and mind.
Play 'never have I ever' - Asking each other to get deep can reveal some new things about your loved one.
Make a video together - The only thing more fun than watching reality TV is making your own. Use your phone to shoot a cooking video, do a tutorial or even give each other makeovers.
Write each other love letters - Getting your feelings down on paper can ignite some real sparks, plus create a keepsake for years to come.
Share family stories - Spend the evening sharing stories about your families and backgrounds.
Plant some herbs or flowers - Buy some seeds or small plants and spend the evening potting them together. It's therapeutic and you'll have something to care for.
Make a date night bucket list - Create a list of fun date ideas you want to try together.
Visit a flea market - Browse a local flea market for unique finds.
Take a short scenic drive - Find a beautiful route near your home for a short drive.
Visit a local garden - Find a beautiful local garden for a peaceful stroll.
Visit a local event - Check for local events, fairs, or small festivals.
Take a photography walk - Bring your phones or cameras and take turns being the photographer. You'll end up with some great memories.
Have a beer or wine tasting at home - Buy a variety of craft beers or wines and taste them together.
Cook a new recipe together - Pick a challenging recipe you've never tried and cook it together.
Order from different food trucks - Find a food truck park and try dishes from different trucks.
Have a progressive dinner - Start with appetizers at one place, main course at another, and dessert at a third.
Buy ingredients and cook together - Visit a farmers market, pick fresh ingredients, then cook a meal.
Learn a dance routine - Pick a popular dance and learn it together from YouTube.
Try bouldering for an hour - Many gyms offer bouldering walls with day passes.
Do partner yoga poses - Try some simple partner yoga poses together.
Rent bikes for an hour - Many cities have bike rental programs for short rides.
Walk in a local park - Find a beautiful local park for a peaceful walk.
Go ice skating - Visit a local ice rink for a fun skating session.
Go roller skating - Visit a roller rink for a retro skating date.
Try martial arts moves - Learn some basic martial arts moves together.
Rent kayaks for an hour - Many lakes offer hourly kayak rentals.
Do a home workout together - Follow a fitness video or app together.
Listen to live music at a local venue - Find a small local band or open mic night for an intimate musical experience.
Read poetry to each other - Pick your favorite poems and take turns reading them aloud in a cozy setting.
Watch an educational video together - Pick an interesting TED talk or documentary and discuss it afterward.
Have a book discussion night - Pick a book you've both read and spend the evening discussing your favorite parts.
Have a foreign film night - Pick a foreign film you've never seen and watch it together with snacks.
Cook a cultural meal together - Pick a cuisine you've never tried and cook a traditional meal together.
Take a historical walking tour - Many cities offer evening walking tours of historical areas.
Do science experiments at home - Try some simple kitchen science experiments together.
Stargaze with an app - Use a stargazing app to identify constellations and planets together.
Watch nature documentaries - Pick an interesting nature documentary and watch it together.
